block.p: Lara Spencer, a television reporter, and David Huffard Haffenreffer Jr., a television news anchor, were married yesterday in Southampton, N.Y. The Rev. Peter M. Larsen, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Andrew's Dune Church.

The bride, 31, will continue to use her name professionally. She works for ''Eyewitness News'' on WABC-TV in New York, and for ''Good Morning America.'' She graduated from Pennsylvania State University. Born Lara Christine von Seelen, she is a daughter of Carolyn and Richard von Seelen of Cutchogue, N.Y. Her father, who is retired, worked in New York as the president of the North American division of Pringle of Scotland, the knitwear manufacturer.

The bridegroom, 33, is a New York anchor for ''Ahead of the Curve,'' a morning television program on the CNN and CNNfn cable news networks. He graduated from St. Lawrence University. He is the son of Susan Haffenreffer and Mr. Haffenreffer Sr. of Providence, R.I. The bridegroom's mother is a clinical social worker for the Bristol County Community Health Center in Taunton, Mass. His father is a vice president in Providence for Fleet Investment Advisers, a unit of FleetBoston Financial.
